Meet with others in your local area interested in building and strengthening the Drupal Community. Discuss new and exciting Drupal-related news - or just socialize with like-minded people!

You can also find us in a couple of other places:

  • #drupal-dc on freenode
  • @DrupalDC on Twitter
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: DC Area Drupal Meetup Group

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
We provide innovative physical and virtual infrastructure that freelancers, entrepreneurs, and creative class professionals need to succeed in the 21st century knowledge economy. What does that really mean?  We provide a professional yet comfortable workspace for freelancers, entrepreneurs, developers, designers, consultants, coaches, lawyers - anyone who might otherwise be working from home or trying to work from a coffee shop.

The (R)evolution of Work

We are a coworking space, but we ain't your usual coworking space. We believe coworking isn't just about a bunch of people sitting under the same roof.  NextSpace was founded on the premise that we are smarter as a group and that by creating not just the space for people to work but also a sense of community an ecology of success develops.  As one of our members put it, "My startup is a year ahead on it's development because of the connections and resources available at NextSpace."  The Santa Cruz location was the very first and we have several other locations between San Francisco and LA.

Where Everybody Knows Your Name

That's the big picture.  For the day to day, it's just really nice to be able to go to a place where you can interact with other people instead of yet another day sitting alone in your spare bedroom. Between our community email lists, happy hours, chit chat friendly kitchen, community mindset and occasional outbursts of wackiness NextSpace is a bit like "Cheers".
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: NextSpace Coworking Union Square

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
The focus of this meetup group to accelerate the pace of getting to know really cool tech people in town. Join now and get the insider invites to our get togethers. Some are impromptu and some are planned. Either way you'll never know if you don't sign up. Our events focus on tech community networking, entrepreneurship, environmental sustainability, and professional development.

 

Please check out a couple of other "on ramps" to our great tech community.

http://www.techlifeohio.com/  - our blog

 http://www.facebook.com/techlifecolumbus - our facebook page

http://www.linkedin.com/groupRegistration?gid=1776905 - our linkedin group

 http://thestartupdigest.com/ - subscribe to our startup digest

 

Peace out,
Ben

Twitter: @bblanquera
http://www.linkedin.com/in/benblanquera
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: TechLife Columbus

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Internet marketing agency owner interested in helping and teaching business owners about how to promote their business more effectively, and in learning new tricks myself.
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Marketing Your Small Business Online

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
StartUP Product Talks is a place to talk about how we can work together to develop amazing products.

Product is evolving. Increasingly, the responsibility of creating and maintaining a great product falls on everyone's shoulders. And nowhere else is that more true than in a startup environment.

How do teams balance both the visionary and executable aspects of building products - beyond customer development?

We welcome people from all disciplines:

  • UX designers
  • Founders, funders, CEOs
  • Software developers
  • Product Marketers, Agile Marketers, Growth Hackers
  • Product managers
  • Community managers
  • Content strategists
  • Business Analysts
  • Project managers
  • And anyone who loves to talk and think about products!

This is a new order of thinking, and there are no answers. Come to share what you've learned and learn from others about the art AND discipline of all the facets involved in the process of breathing life into a product, managing actionable goals and producing scalable businesses...

We encourage open debate so the group can learn from us and each other. Monthly StartUp Product Talks may be led by a guest speaker or a panel of experts.

“StartUp Product Talks” is also a networking function. An opportunity for anyone passionate about product quality and what it takes to delight customers to come together to meet, interact, and network. The ideal environment within which sharing and learning can flourish and complement the knowledge base for all on a peer to peer basis. We’re keen for Product People across different industries to meet up and exchange business cards. You never know where your next job offer will come from.

Please come with strong opinions and a desire to voice them!

Shouldn't San Francisco be where The Rise of The Product Professional movement begins?!

Join us at Startup Product Summit Feb 7, 2013

Discover how to work together to develop amazing products

http://startupproduct.com

Get updates: http://bit.ly/WtN2oY


--->In between face to face events, participate in regular Global Product Management Talk broadcasts: for product professionals who can't leave their desks to participate in Product Talks, we bring them to you via Twitter Chat and Podcast! http://www.prodmgmttalk.com

Follow: http://www.blogtalkradio.com/prodmgmttalk

"Read" events via crowdsourced tweets, pics and content: http://storify.com/prodmgmttalk
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: StartUP Product Talks San Francisco

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: The Santa Barbara Quantified Self Meetup is inspired by other Quantified Self Meetups and the Quantified Self blog. It is a regular show and tell for people who are tracking data about their body and conducting their own personal investigations and research into their bodies, minds, and selves. Anything is game -- from personal genetics to ways to digitize and track information, from how to self-diagnose to how to self-experiment with data and statistics. More specific topics include: * self-experimentation * using data and statistics to further self-experimentation * behavior monitoring, tracking, and modification (including studying habit forming and breaking) * lifelogging, lifecaching, and lifestreaming * location tracking * generating, capturing, and working with biometric data * psychological self-assessments * medical self-diagnostics and keeping track of one's own medical data * personal genetics and genome sequencing Other good sources of information and inspiration are: The Bay Area QS Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/quantifiedself/) The NYC QS Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/NYQuantifiedSelf/) and the QS Blog (http://www.quantifiedself.org)
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Quantified Self Santa Barbara

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
Welcome to NYC Mobile Apps!

We host events to inspire, educate, and accelerate the NYC mobile community.

Our focus is iOS and Android development/design, all the way through to marketing and advertising.

Our mission is to cultivate a sustainable NYC mobile community that drives innovation in software around the world.

 

The format:

- Demos: App/Technology previews

- Discussion and Networking: A lively discussion where we cover current topics and network with others in the NYC mobile community


Serko Artinian

nycapps@me.com
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: NYC Mobile Apps

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: A community supported space for digital entrepreneurs.
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: SURF Incubator

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
BABS was founded to foster the local community of content creators, bloggers, authors, web experts, ebook creators, publishers and online marketing professionals. Our in-person meetings go deep and wide into the culture and tools of digital connection. Members share tips & tricks, hear new concepts by local start-up owners, brainstorm blog elements, and network for mutual success. Attending our meetings, you will find new blogging buddies, support for your ideas, and answers to your technical questions. If you have tips to share or would like to let people know about your own services, come join us.

Authors Go Public meetups are our most recent innovation. These are designed to help bloggers and authors find the best ebook production tools, and develop cutting-edge marketing plans to help sell their quality ebooks. Authors Go Public events include keynotes, panels, and Ignite-style speakers on subjects ranging from digital publishing to author platforms and converting blog readers to book buyers. AGP meetups are scheduled in San Francisco, Marin and Sonoma throughout 2012-13.

Our agenda includes forming local "ePub Clubs" which are small groups of people who work closely together to move their publishing forward. This includes all forms of ebooks for all forms of e-readers, including Kindle. ePublishing is a powerful and fast-moving aspect of online content which we all need to be aware of, whether we are writers working on our careers or website owners with content to share.

We also learn good marketing practices to employ for our websites and online businesses. The Internet provides us with many affordable options for reaching an audience or client base. The trick is to learn and use these tools without being overwhelmed or wasting precious time! At our BABS meetings and other classes offered by our members, we share the best of all the current tools.

On this MeetUp we announce BABS gatherings in San Francisco, Marin, Sonoma, and the East Bay. You will also learn about classes, workshops and talks given by our members to support your ongoing development as a modern communicator.

Topics we discuss include digital publishing, Kindle publishing tools, author platforms, finding great domain names, using blog tools (especially Wordpress), keeping costs down, using social media to expand our reach, gaining influence online, writing spectacular content that attracts a loyal following, and different avenues for monetization. We also teach microblogging (Twitter), and the newest options for cutting-edge blogs.

If you are an author publishing any kind of online content including fiction, writing a blog (or want to start one), want to find out about social media marketing for your business, or just need to be around some interesting people, come join us at the next BABS meeting. All blogging professionals are invited to network and share your products and services as well.
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: BABS - Bay Area Bloggers Society

Learn from others in our community about how to put this system to work for you effectively. Other topics for discussion Search Engine Optimization, Site Monetization, Website Business planning, Theme Designs, Theme customizations, Plugins, html, php Blogging for personal reasons, blogging for business, blogging for your community organization, social networking, twitter, linkedin, facebook and more.

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
Are you interested in volunteering to help an older adult learn technology?

  • This involves helping seniors follow along during the workshop
  • You don't need to know any in depth software and technical knowledge
  • Just be patience and guide the senior who is struggling to keep up with the class
  • No orientation is needed to be a great volunteer; just patience and willingness.

Bluehair Technology Group needs technology comfortable volunteers to help out at workshops across metro Atlanta. These workshops are held at independent living communities and senior centers. They last about 1 1/2 hours each. If you understand how to use laptops, tablets, smartphones and e-readers - and have patience - WE NEED YOU!

Bluehair Technology Group is a nonprofit organization. Our mission is to educate adult seniors about current technology and the tools that enable them to stay connected with family, friends and their passions.

-
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Help a senior learn technology. Be a Technology Ambassador.

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
For folks who desire to have fun playing with data and develop both strong technical ability and skills to apply data science and analytic results to critical business issues.

A data scientist is somebody who can play with data, spot trends and learn truths few others know. Data scientists are inquisitive: exploring, asking questions, doing “what if” analysis, questioning existing assumptions and processes.

Data Science: the analysis of data creation. The data scientist has a solid foundation in computer science, modeling, statistics, analytics, math and strong business acumen, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and IT leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge.

Business Analytics: the practice of iterative, methodical exploration of an organization’s data with emphasis on statistical analysis.
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Data Science & Business Analytics

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
Our group is made up of a bunch of young(21-35z) geeky peeps in the Raleigh area who enjoy hanging out for two purposes: 

 

1. Have fun! 

We do lots of fun and random stuff like game nights, trivia nights, pot lucks, movies, bonfires, bowling, Nerf wars, shag dancing, art museums, putt-putt, go-karts, laser-tag, knitting, paintball, brewing, and the like.

 

2. Make a difference!

We feed the homeless, mentor students, build things for people in need, gathering supplies and money for kids in poor countries, and other random things to let people know they are loved. We also discuss the important things in life like family, God, purpose, and truth.

 

So if you like to have fun and make a difference and want to meet people with the same interests, then check out some of our events!
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Raleigh Nerd Herd

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
We're looking for founders, developers, and designers who want to build real tech startups at the hackathons of our DataWeek.co and DeveloperWeek.com conferences!

Our hackathons are usually the 'kick-off' events for our giant conferences where we invite dozens of speakers, advisors, and partners to provide coaching and free services for our hackathon teams.

 

You can expect direct coaching from 12+ silicon valley VC's and engineers in Node.js, MongoDB, Ruby on Rails, Javascript, HTML 5..... We've had advisors from Google, Twilio, 10gen MongoDB, General Catalyst Partners, Palantir, dotCloud, Battery Ventures, and dozens more.... and in 2013 we'll invite our advisor network to help turn your hackathon apps into full-scale startups!
AUTH_GROUP.NAME: Startup + Hackathon // SF Bay

AUTH_GROUP.DESCRIPTION:
About SVCWireless


Silicon Valley-China Wireless Technology Association (SVCWireless) is a leading non-profit, non-bias independent professional organization to bridge the technology industries between China and the United States. The organization is founded in year 2000 and now has more than 5000 members and 30 partners around the world. SVCWireless promotes entrepreneurship, innovation, and venture investment with the support from our members, sponsors and partners.

For more information, please visit http://www.svcwireless.org

Sign up SVCWireless membership or email list at http://svcwireless.eventbrite.com

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
DEC & SBDC Present: Market Your Way to Success

Program:

Marketing is the heart and soul of your business. To be successful you have to know who your best customer's are, what your customer wants and then use that information to strategically position your product or service to be recognized by, appeal to and to effectively persuade them to purchase. Come to the Market Your Way to Success series and learn how to present the best your company has to offer!

Session 1 - 1/11: Identifying and Determining Your Target Market.
Session 2 - 1/18: Building a Branded Message and Image that Works.
Session 3 - 1/25: Developing Marketing Strategies that Sell.

Session 4 - 2/1: Review of Sessions 1-3.

This event is offered at "No Cost". To participate the attendee MUST commit to attend all three sessions. You must Register to participate.

Export to Outlook or iCal (.ics)

ShareTwitter

Website or Map: http://maps.google.com/maps?q�
EVENT.TAGS: Entrepreneur,Education & Technology,New Technology,Web Technology,Internet & Technology,Startup Ventures

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
--->NOTE: This is a FREE DIGITAL EVENT at your location on your device where-ever you are! Requires registration & gotowebinar download to attend.

REGISTER NOW: http://bit.ly/Wc8LGD

More info & slides following event: http://bit.ly/X4WHCP

(First time attending a Webinar on the GoToWebinar Platform?
Watch HOW TO ATTEND THE WEBINAR Quickstart Video: http://bit.ly/SRZ4ei)

This webinar is part of the AIPMM Webinar Series moderated by Cindy F. Solomon

There is often a wide gap between the priorities of projects within the development organization, the priority of the project in the view of the overall business, and the priority of the project in the eyes of the requester.

Managers frequently invest in a process approach and attempt to get buy-in across functions to that process. However, attempting to solve a problem using the same tools that created the problem is ineffective and does not generate the breakthrough.

Join this webinar to learn the frequent mistakes that plague software development projects and how to remedy them once and for all. The speaker will use the tool he has developed, Sprint.ly, to demonstrate how to manage product decisions to ship product more quickly.

"I look at the Product Manager's job to run down the objective signals throughout the company, synthesize/distill them, and then use those signals to inform product decisions. Our big thing is that you can tell a lot more about how things are going from the information streams (or lack thereof) than from process management in itself," says Joe Stump, CEO, Sprint.ly

About the Speaker:

Joe Stump is a seasoned technical leader and serial entrepreneur who has co-founded three venture-backed startups including SimpleGeo and attachments.me, was Lead Architect of Digg, and has invested in and advised dozens of companies. He is passionate about development processes, iterative product development, and building scalable web infrastructure. He's worked on small systems with fledgling startups and massive process and technical changes at multinational corporations.

Joe has authored pieces for O'Reilly's ONLAMP.com and has spoken at Web 2.0 Expo, Future of Web Apps, Future of Web Design, Kings of Code, The Next Web, Q-Con, SXSW, MySQL Conference, DjangoCon, and PHP-Con, to name a few. Joe has a BA in Computer Information Systems from Eastern Michigan University.


Sprint.ly. Don't ask how it's going; watch how it's going in real time with https://Sprint.ly

@JoeStump is a featured speaker at Startup Product Summit on February 7
EVENT.TAGS: Product Design,New Technology,Web Development,Software Development,Mobile Technology,Startup Ventures,San Francisco,Startup Businesses,Product Launch,Software Product Management,Lean Software Development,New Product Development: Software & Tech,Product Management,Startups,Product management in agile
EVENT.TITLE: Webcast: Informing Product Decisions: How To Move Faster With Less Process

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Developer Friday takes place the first Friday of each month. The intention is to get developers of all types - cubical dwellers, startup ninjas, freelancing mercenaries - to cowork together for a day, providing a chance for some good interaction: meeting fellow developers, sharing ideas, getting feedback, solving problems.

As always, bring your laptop, your work, and - as long as they come willingly - a few co-workers (if you have them).

Thanks to the Hive for providing internet access, snacks, and beverages throughout the day.

EVENT.TITLE: Free First Friday

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
This a FREE event. Our way of giving back, so we expect for you to Pay It Forward as well.

This 1-day course offers a fairytale fable of Lean, Agile, Scrum & Kanban that will provide an overview principles and practices of each one. This is a part of our Pay It Forward Fridays (PIFF) series.

The course itself uses the principles of Kanban & Scrum, where the learning outcome is driven by the needs of the participants through a combination of expert instruction and self-directed learning. Opportunities to reflect and adapt the direction of the course are offered at regular intervals.

At the end of the training, the participants will have a basic understanding of Lean, Agile, Scrum & Kanban.

The following elements will be covered during the one day course

* An overview of the foundations of Lean and what it means to them.
* An overview of the Agile Manifesto and what it means to them.
* An overview of the tenets of Scrum and it's application.
* An overview of the tenets of Kanban and it's application

About your Instructor:

Devon A. Morris, PMP, PMI-ACP, CSM, PSM, CSP, LSSBB, SSBB
Back in 2000, Devon learned about Scrum without forking over any cash and has used Agile and Lean frameworks ever since. He has trained over 1000 people with his unique style and worked with a number of large organizations to assist in their adoption and use of Lean & Agile frameworks, methodologies & practices. Devon was formally trained by Ken Schwaber in 2005 and on the hard knocks streets of "Corporate America" by practicing what he preaches. Time spent with him is always engaging and fun.
http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=10425731
EVENT.TAGS: Agile Software,Extreme Programming,Scrum,Software Development,Lean Thinking,Agile Project Management,Lean Methodology,Test Driven Development,Agile Methods,Kanban,Lean Startup,Agile Software Development,Lean Software Development,lean,Agile Coaching
EVENT.TITLE: PIFF: Lean, Agile, Scrum, Kanban (oh my) - Dallas, TX

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Today we're going to check out the old Elgin Watch Factory #2 location located at 366 Bluff City Blvd, Elgin, IL 60120. It's on the corner of Bluff City Blvd and Raymond St.


At this location are fellow ETC members: Pro Techs, Edison Avenue Consulting, Realm 249, On Site, and Creative Firestorm. We will take a quick tour of the two story space and have lunch in the main conference room. Bring your own or let's split some Maciano's Pizza.

Plant No. 2 was located at 366 Bluff City Boulevard in Elgin, Illinois. Opened in 1925, it was acquired by the Elgin National Watch Company in 1940. In 1947 it had 64,930 square feet. No. 2 was closed in 1949 and re-opened in 1951. It was sold by Elgin National Industries in 1972, but a small watch repair operation continued to occupy it.

We will meet at ETC at 11:30 on Fridays and leave as a group to our chosen destination. Bring your business cards and join us!

One of our on-going projects is to build a file-transfer system to send the week's editions in PDF from the Durango Herald over to the Durango Public Library as part of the library's on-going archiving of the Herald.

Less Yak. More Hack.

CFLunch is a casual meeting format, often without specific predefined topics, and never with formal presentations. It's a gathering of like minded ColdFusion enthusiasts over food. But it's not restricted to ColdFusion enthusiasts - anyone is invited. Invite coworkers and friends. As long as they are willing to put up with a little shop talk they are welcome to join in!

Please RSVP so we can obtain a large enough table to accomodate everyone.

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
RubyMotion (http://www.rubymotion.com) is a relatively new commercial toolchain for writing, testing, and compiling native iOS applications with familiar Ruby tools.

Rake, Bundler, RSpec/Bacon, and your favorite text editor make building iOS apps with Ruby less painful (and more beautiful) than using Xcode and Objective-C.

We will explore what RubyMotion is, how it works, why it's useful, and how to get started. We'll even build and test an application right on the spot.

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Just like New York City, mobile moves fast. That's why we want to bring the NYC mobile community more events and resources to accelerate mobile innovation.

That's why we're excited to partner with Alley NYC (a fast-growing NY tech hub & co-working space) to bring you Alley Weekly, your chance to chat with NY tech's thought leaders, investors and entrepreneurs. Plus, you get lunch!

Every Friday, grab some food and gain some knowledge during a fireside chat. We've already had Charlie O'Donnell, Micah Rosenbloom, & Jame Altchur and we're just getting started.

**YOU MUST PURCHASE A TICKET THROUGH EVENTBRITE IN ORDER TO RSVP**


This week, come chat with Arie Abecassis.

Arie is Co-Founder of AppStori and a Venture Partner at DreamIt Ventures, one of the top accelerators in the world. He�s been actively involved in the New York tech community as an investor and entrepreneur and currently sits on the boards of: SeatGeek, Adaptly, and BiznessApps. He has been published in Mashable, Venture Beat, and The Wall Street Journal.

RSVP here.

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Come to a Lunch and Learn with HasOffers:

HasOffers built a performance marketing platform on Amazon's AWS tracking over a billion events per month. We'll share the technical lessons learned that helped us become a startup success. In addition to showing what works well, we'll discuss what we would have done differently given the chance to start over.

HasOffers won the Seattle 2.0 Bootstrapper of the Year award. It's matured to over fifty employees, is entirely self-funded, and still growing fast. HasOffers builds performance marketing SaaS solutions for affiliate programs and mobile apps.

EVENT.TITLE: A Startup Success: HasOffers Past and Present

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
I am excited to announce our first Online Hangout of 2013, happening next Friday, Feb. 1! My guest will be consultant, speaker, and blogger Dan Blank, who will be talking to us about author platforms and how to grow a community of readers.

Dan Blank founded We Grow Media in 2009, where he helps writers build their platforms and helps publishers grow their online communities. He has trained hundreds of writers in online content and marketing skills, and works individually with writers and authors to help develop their brand and tap into communities in meaningful ways.

Dan teaches online courses through Writers Digest and MediaBistro, and speaks extensively at writing and publishing conferences. I am really looking forward to interviewing Dan about his work, and I hope you can join Suzanna and I on Google+ Feb. 1!

Here's how our Online Hangouts work:

If You Want to Join the Video Chat:

1. Read Dan's blog (http://wegrowmedia.com/blog/), and find out what he has to say about writing, publishing, and connecting with readers.

2. Be prepared with a question or two to ask, related to his area of expertise.

3. Follow the directions below to join the Google Hangout.

If You Just Want to Watch Our Talk with Dan Blank:

1. The live stream will be embedded right here on this page! So if you're free at noon on Feb. 1, pull up this page in your browser and watch the video live.

2. Watch the video here anytime after the event, it will be on this page permanently!

How the Google+ Hangout series works: Once you RSVP for this BABS event, head over to Google+ and connect with me (Anne Hill) there. I will add you to the circle of BABS members who automatically get invited to the hangout. Up to 7 members can join us in the live video feed.
EVENT.TAGS: Entrepreneur,Small Business,Writers,Indie Publishing,eBook,WordPress,Bloggers,Authors,Social Media Marketing,Content Strategy,Digital Publishing,Self Publishing,ePublishing,ebook conversion into ePub
EVENT.TITLE: Online (Google+) Hangout�Dan Blank on Author Platforms and Community Building

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
AIR Studio Launch � Friday 1 February 2013

You are invited to the Academy for Innovation & Research (AIR) for the launch of the AIR Studio on the Friday 1st February 2013 @ 1pm at Tremough Campus, Treliever Road, Penryn TR10 9EZ.

The AIR Studio is a new facility based on the successful Pervasive Media Studio in Bristol. Its aim is to provide an accessible venue for collaborations that encourage follow-through on research ideas across organisations. It�s a place to find things out and a place for inspiration, connection and action.

At the launch you will learn about the opportunities available to the business and cultural sectors in Cornwall.

1:00 pm - The afternoon will start with tea & coffee in the AIR Studio

1:30 pm - Overview of the Studio by Jeremy Richards, Head of innovation at Falmouth University

- Followed by guest speaker Clare Reddington, Director of the Pervasive Media Studio

2:45 pm - Afternoon tea with the opportunity to learn about some of the emerging projects and a chance to find out more about what�s on offer

5:00 pm - Close
If you would like to attend, book your ticket on EventBrite:
http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/event/5140661858

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Mixpanel Mobile & Web Analytics Platform Online Demo Friday February 1, 2013 @ 2:00 PM MDT

Note: This is an ONLINE DEMO. DO NOT GO TO PHYSICAL ADDRESS!

Call for audio: 415.464.6999
Password: 463-574-939
Click for video: http://join.me/retention

Mixpanel is an advanced analytics platform that helps improve web and mobile applications by tracking how users interact & engage. The MixPanel Platform essentially gives websites a plug and play analytics offering for their users. Developers insert a few lines of code, and then users can access MixPanel�s variety of realtime analytics for their services. The platform offers the ability to track how many comments, subscribers, likes, shares, and page views users are getting. MixPanel will place all of this data on a dashboard for a business� users to check and monitor.

Mixpanel Engage turns analytics into targeted messages to specific users to increase conversions and activity on websites and mobile apps. The idea is to not spam the entire user base but just specific users who could benefit from some information.

For example, Mixpanel customer Airbnb has users who stop during their booking of a reservation. Airbnb can now send a message a day later, with a link to automatically click to book that rental. Most companies don�t have that data available and ready to send to customers. As another example: an e-commerce app can notify only fans of a particular brand that a new product is available from that brand. Or a gaming company can notify users when they have trouble passing a certain level with tips to pass the level.

See: https://mixpanel.com
EVENT.TAGS: Data Management,Business Intelligence,hadoop,Big Data,Machine Learning,Data Analytics,Data Visualization,Predictive Analytics,Data Mining,NoSQL,R Project for Statistical Computing
EVENT.TITLE: Mixpanel Mobile & Web Analytics Platform Online Demo Fri Feb 1, 2013 @2:00PM MDT

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Fundraising - You don't do it often. And when you get down to it, its all about the deal. We're setting up a mock negotiation for you all to witness how its done and what to pay attention to. Don't make first time mistakes.

Whether you're a first-time or serial entrepreneur, if you're really making progress, you will find yourself negotiating term sheets with an investor and lawyers. Come find out the "Do's and Don'ts" of negotiations while watching a mock negotiation between an active angel investor, startup attorney and a successful CEO. It doesn't get any better than this.

We will go over a worst case scenario as a way to review how the terms play out and their importance.

We will be sending out sample term sheets to review.

Who should attend: Those seeking funding. How to get funding at various stages. From early to late. How to access a deal for funding viability and what happens at the negotiation table.

RANDOLPH ADLER, Jr. is the Managing Partner and Co-Founder of RK ADLER LLP. Randy represents numerous technology, new media, fashion, and other similarly situated start-up, venture-backed, and emerging companies at all stages of development. He also represents various investors, funds and family businesses that seek independent counsel. Randy�s practice focuses on corporate and strategic matters, which he employs as an outside general counsel for many of the firm�s clients.

Immediately prior to co-founding RK ADLER LLP, Randy was a corporate litigation attorney at the Manhattan office of Skadden, Arps, Meagher & Flom LLP. Randy attended the University of Richmond, the University of Queensland, and St. John�s University School of Law in Queens, New York.

Mark Peter Davis is a Venture Partner at High Peaks Venture Partners. Mark focuses on identifying and investing in New York-based software and internet deals. He is a Co-Founder of Kohort Inc. and serves as its CEO. He is a Mentor at Techstars, LLC. He serves as an Advisor to SuburbanMomma. Previously, he served as an Associate at Draper Fisher Jurvetson Gotham Ventures. Prior to that, Mark co-founded GoodSearch, LLC in 2005 and served as its Chief Executive Officer. In addition to his entrepreneurial endeavors, Mr. Davis consulted to Fortune 1000 and private equity clients on the strategic and financial attractiveness of acquisition targets at both Bain & Company and KPMG. Mark is an occasional Contributor to a number of industry new services, including Mashable, Silicon Alley Insider and CenterNetworks. In addition to creating content, he organizes events for entrepreneurs through the Columbia Venture Community. He is an Active Member of the venture community. He is the author of Get Venture and is frequently cited in the Wall Street Journal. He was listed by BusinessInsider as one of the 100 Most Influential Digital New Yorkers.

Dane currently serves as CEO SumAll, a business he co-founded. Previously he has served as CEO Squarespace and CEO Sensenet. He's a serial entrepreneur having founded 6 startups over the course of his career, achieving 5 exits. He also is an advisor/ investor and board member to a dozen more companies.

Hosted at Internet Media Labs - hub for social companies.
EVENT.TAGS: Social Enterprise,Internet Professionals,Internet & Technology,Social Media,Web Development,Mobile Technology,Social Media Marketing,Big Data,Viral Marketing,Social Media for Business,Social Media Management,Startup & Enterprenurs,Social CRM,Business Strategies and Networking,social media analytics

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Join us for a big blowout of creative impulses in Bergen � 1st to 3rd of february!

So what is this StartupWeekend concept really all about � you might think. Well, here is the recipe:

  • A few handfulls of clever businesspeople, entrepreneurs and random enthusiasts
  • One portion of geeky developers
  • A dash of creative designers

Stir well together with some great ideas, divide into teams, sprinkle some mentorship on top and let sit for 54 hours in room temperature.

** WARNING: Temperature may rise as a result of high voltage imagination.

Now this is the part where it usually starts bubbling � we let in the judges! Some fine examples of wise heads will enter the scene and grill the teams for a few minutes, before they decide which team will be of the winning kind.

The results � in some cases a fresh baked business idea turned into a fulltime job for the team members, i.e. like Pido � from the last StartupWeekend event.

Interested? Want to know more? Visit our website at:
bergen.startupweekend.org/

Oh, you are already convinced? You want to sign up? Well, OK then � go go go! �
bergen.startupweekend.org/tickets/

If you guys are in the area and are interested in coming, hit me at adelany333@gmail.com and let me know, so I can get an estimate of the number of people coming out. I�m really excited about this, and if I have half as much fun as I did last time, it will be a solid night.

EVENT.TITLE: Philadelphia Menswear MeetUp

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Open Source Friday's at Josh Office

For the past few months, we have been having a lot of fun on Friday evening - we don't work! We hack on some open-source gems, work on some internal ideas (gems, rails projects and techniques) and we found it to be very useful (and fun).

We decided that this could be a good idea for the community - so every Friday @ 5.30pm, anyone interested in Ruby and any Ruby related technologies is more than welcome to over.

Have an Idea?

If you have an idea and want to get the Ruby community to build it, you're welcome here - you can propose your idea and if there is a quorum, we can work on it.

Love coding?

Come on over and code with others. Bring your own laptop and share your knowledge with others

What do you need to bring?

Yourself and your laptop if you want to code. We shall provide snacks and soft-drinks at our office.

Beer sponsors - always welcome! Contact gautam@joshsoftware.com if you want to show your appreciation.
EVENT.TAGS: Ruby,Cloud Computing,Ruby On Rails,Test Driven Development,Agile Software Development
EVENT.TITLE: Open Source Friday's

EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Let's get together and chat about developing with new Laravel 4 framework!
EVENT.TAGS: MySQL,New Technology,Web Development,Programming,PHP Application Development,PHP Framework
EVENT.TITLE: Talk about upcoming Laravel 4

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
As Peter Neubauer and Michael Hunger are in town, we thought it would be nice to have a meetup the day before FOSDEM - GraphDevRoom

We have a number of topics that we could talk about and wanted to know which of those would be interesting for you:


Spring Data Neo4j - Object Graph Mapping made easy
Neo4j Spatial - handling geographic information in a graph, Geo-APIs, OpenStreetMap
Structr CMS - a novel CMS built on top of Neo4j
Neo4j in the wild - interesting real-life applications of Neo4j


Please state your interest so that we can prepare accordingly.
EVENT.TAGS: Graphic Design,Big Data,Data Analytics,Data Visualization,NoSQL,Neo4j,Graph Databases,Data
EVENT.TITLE: Discuss some cool Graph Topics

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
It only happens once a month, but First Friday is a great way to experience downtown Raleigh. Events typically run from 6-9 p.m., and involve tons of art galleries, studios, restaurants and other venues in downtown Raleigh.

All places participating in First Friday will have flags outside.

We're going to start out at Tir na Nog at 6pm for dinner, and then head out to the galleries around 7pm.

Just a block over from Tir na Nog, our first stop will be ArtSpace (if you can't make it for dinner, meet us there around 7ish). Then we'll probably check out Amplified Art, which is around the corner, then we'll head over towards the CAM and make a few stops along the way. If enough people are interested afterwards, we can hang at one of the many nearby pubs.
EVENT.TAGS: Outdoor Recreation,Fun & Games Night,Meeting New People,Community Service,God,Movies/Dinner,Geeks & Nerds
EVENT.TITLE: First Friday + Dinner at Tir na Nog

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT FOR HACKATHON-ONLY PASSES! If you want to attend, you need to purchase a DeveloperWeek 2013 Conference Pass which includes Hackathon participation:

http://developerweek.eventbrite.com/

How the DeveloperWeek Hackathon Works....

The DeveloperWeek Hackathon is a 43-hour app-building contest in downtown San Francisco from Friday February 2nd until Sunday February 3rd - and is also the official kick-off of DeveloperWeek 2013! The purpose of the hackathon is to give developers, designers, and entrepreneurs the chance to pitch app ideas - form teams - build a prototype of their app - and present to our hackathon judges for a chance to be one of the top 5 hackathon winners who get "incubated" during DeveloperWeek.


The DeveloperWeek hackathon is unlike any other SF hackathon because the top 5 hackathon winners will get 4 days of coaching, 4 days of legal and design services, and free tech tools to help 'incubate' their app into a viable startup company by the last day of DeveloperWeek. These 5 hackathon winners then compete again on-stage on Thursday February 7th of DeveloperWeek so our community can help launch your startup!

Hackathon Rules.....

1- You can prepare wireframes, outlines, or notes but you cannot start any of your design or development until Saturday February 2th at noon!

2- Teams must consist of at least 1 person but at max 5 people

3- Your team and your app will be judged based on 3 criteria: 1) Are you solving a real problem in an interesting way? 2) How well did you present? 3) How much progress did you make on your app?

4- If you build using a sponsor's technology then you are also eligible for the sponsor prize!
EVENT.TAGS: Web Development,Mobile Development,Founders,Coding,Social Coding,Hackers,Startups,hackathons
EVENT.TITLE: DeveloperWeek 2013 Hackathon!!

Event Introduction

China has the No.1 Internet and Mobile Internet Market with the largest Internet population. Meanwhile, China Internet market and user pattern are unique and challenging even for the leading Internet companies.

  • Are you missing any opportunities in the fast-growing China Internet and Mobile Internet market?
  • What is the right approach to expand your business to China, flying solo, partnering, or acquisition?
  • At the time of Capital Winter in China, is this the right time to grab valuable deals?

SVCWireless presents 8 quality Internet and Mobile Internet companies to you right here in the center of Bay Area. Investment, Partnership, Jobs and Beers, come and grab one for yourself.

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
If you want to learn Ruby on Rails, this is the place!

Friday, Feb 1st, 6:00-9pm (REQUIRED): software install fest
Saturday Feb 2nd: 9:30am-4pm: workshop
4:30pm: after-party for volunteers & attendees, location TBA

This workshop is intended to reach out to women who are new to Ruby and Rails. Men are welcome to come: please find the woman in your life who wants to learn Ruby and Rails and she can sign up and bring you as her guest. When registering, guys, you will be asked who you are coming as a guest of please be sure to fill out this question.

Total programming novices, system administrators, developers in other languages, and folks who attended our previous workshops and need a refresher are all welcome. We'll have different groups separated by experience level. Each participant needs to bring his or her own laptop to work on.

The workshop is FREE of charge!

In this workshop, we'll take you through building a complete web application using Ruby on Rails. By the end of the workshop, you'll have an application on the internet that connects to a database and reads and writes information.

We'll meet up Install Fest day to install all of the software you need, and then spend workshop day learning and writing code. You must attend the Install Fest on Friday so we can all get working on our Rails project first thing Saturday.

When you RSVP you'll be asked a few question about your laptop operating system, level and type of programming experience, and whether you will be bringing any children. If possible we prefer to find other arrangements but let us know in the questionnaire if you need to bring children and we'll sort something out.

Snacks will be provided Friday evening and lunch will be provided on Saturday.
If you have questions or ideas for us, the best way to get in touch is to send an email to desi.mcadam@gmail.com

Parking info:

There is free street parking directly in front of the building that may be available, and failing that there are two all-day paid lots directly to the south and west of the building. Metered parking down the street is limited to 2 hours. Alternatively, the Union Station light rail stop and mall shuttle are about an 8 minute walk away.
EVENT.TAGS: Ruby,Internet Professionals,Web Technology,Women in Technology,Web Development,Programming,Colorado Technology,Ruby On Rails,Women Programmers
EVENT.TITLE: RailsBridge Women's Ruby and Ruby On Rails Workshop

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Hi NonDysFunctional Programmers,

Amir Chaudhry from OCaml Labs [3] is sponsoring an OCaml meetup, and has asked me to share this invite with you. Note that you'll have to register with the URL provided below -- Meetup RSVPs won't count! I'll quote Amir's email here:

I'm organising an informal OCaml meetup/hacking session for Friday 1st February. The idea is for anyone interested in OCaml, from novice to guru, to meetup and do some hacking with other people. Some of the folks attending include Anil, who's writing a book about OCaml [1] and Thomas, author of a popular package manager (and currently visiting from France) [2]. They might even be persuaded to do some short talks earlier on. There will be nibbles and I'll likely organise some pizza/food later on too (courtesy of OCaml Labs [3]).

We're lucky that we'll be holding this event at Makespace, especially as it isn't formally open yet. Makespace is a place where members can work on physical projects and build things. This event is very much a trial for them so we should do the equivalent of buying them a pint to say thanks! I'll have a donation tin at the event or you can donate directly via PayPal [4]. Average price of a pint is about �3, just so you know :)

What: OCaml Meetup/Hacking session
When: Friday 1st Feb, 6pm-9pm
Where: Makespace (off Mill Lane)
Register: http://bit.ly/13MKoRq

[1] http://www.realworldocaml.org
[2] http://opam.ocamlpro.com
[3] http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/projects/ocamllabs/
[4] http://makespace.org/donations/ (NB Makespace is a non-profit)
EVENT.TAGS: Lisp & Scheme,Programming Languages,Haskell,Functional Programming,Clojure,Scala Programming,Erlang Programming,Common Lisp,OCaml Programming
EVENT.TITLE: OCaml Meetup/hacking session

EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Hey Hackers,

Thanks to everyone who came out last Friday! I saw some absolutely awesome projects people were working on, and it seemed as though much microcontrollery was had by all.

A quick announcement: for those who do not already know, RingRevenue (http://www.ringrevenue.com/) and RightSignature (https://rightsignature.com/) are generously hosting a 24-hour Hackathon next Friday, February 1st at 6 PM at their offices. This will go until 3 or 4 PM the following day, at which point you can present what you have built to everyone else. Thanks to the venues, you are welcome to stay and work for the entire night. (Last time Colin Kelley and others brought sleeping bags...no joke.)

The theme of this Hackathon is simply: Modern Web.

The hosters request that you sign up to attend here: https://docs.google.com/a/ringrevenue.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Atez_Jze1MaxdHpJTFg2VXpQSUFSa2pGMzVpak9nSVE#gid=0

More general information about the event here: http://www.sbhackathon.com/

Happy hacking!

Jim
EVENT.TAGS: Open Source,Web Design,Ruby,Software Developers,JavaScript,Web Development,iPhone developers,Programming,Android developers,Ruby On Rails,Mobile Development,HTML5
EVENT.TITLE: 24-Hour Hackathon at RingRevenue and RightSignature
